column4: If I try to remove the gcc base, it says I have to remove practically all of ubuntu....
I want to downgrade to gcc 3.4
The thing is, there's no gcc left on my system at all
everytime I try to install 3.4 it allows me to do so in synaptic, goes trough all the movements, but... no gcc installed
I want gcc 3.4 to be my default, that's all
it's not very practical to have 2 versions of gcc on the system when you only use one of them!
thats standard linux , not just deb
no it'll get me back to nothing and I'm stuck to gcc 4.2
nothings wrong with 'cmd' if you know how to use it ;-0
dont oh plz me, you were just askin about the purpose of updatedb.. ;-
